body_content.explanation: relating to the study of pollen (= the powder, produced by the male part of a flower, that causes the female part of the same type of flower to produce seeds) and spores (= reproductive cells produced by some plants and simple organisms):
examples: Pollen records from the mountainous area provide palynological evidence for how the vegetation has shifted over time.
Palynological analysis results were disappointing because pollen residues were very sparse.
